item.title: Introducing Hana
item.media:title: Introducing Hana
item.media:description: Lovely host Hana Etsuko Dethlefsen shows us how to make two of the most popular Japanese foods at home: sushi and tempura.

item.title: Veal Episode with Chef Michael Cummings
item.media:title: Veal Episode with Chef Michael Cummings
item.media:description: Wonder why chefs like to cook with veal? Chef Michael Cummings heats up the studio while working with various cuts of veal.

item.title: Deep Fry Episode with Chef Michael Bonacini
item.media:title: Deep Fry Episode with Chef Michael Bonacini
item.media:description: Chef Michael Bonacini shows why he is no small fry in revealing his kitchen sizzle. Learn the secrets on sautéing, pan frying and deep frying.

item.title: Stuffed Pasta Episode with Chef Tim McRoberts
item.media:title: Stuffed Pasta Episode with Chef Tim McRoberts
item.media:description: The secrets of stuffed pasta are revealed as Chef Tim McRoberts dresses each pasta for success by padding them with delicious fillings, sprinkling them with fragrant seasoning and topping each off with the perfect sauce.

item.title: Mise En Place Episode with Chef Ned Bell
item.media:title: Mise En Place Episode with Chef Ned Bell
item.media:description: Every chef knows that cooking starts with smart planning. Chef Ned Bell demonstrates the techniques behind those fascinating preparation skills only a chef seems able to do.

item.title: Game Episode with Chef Michael Allemeier
item.media:title: Game Episode with Chef Michael Allemeier
item.media:description: Chef Allemeier embraces his wild side and reveals the secrets to cooking with a variety of game meats.

item.title: Sauces Episode with Chef Elizabeth Manville
item.media:title: Sauces Episode with Chef Elizabeth Manville
item.media:description: Chef Elizabeth Manville lets us in on the secrets of those incredible sauces made in great restaurants. From rich creamy buttery sauces to light fragrant herb sauces, Chef takes us through them from the starting ingredients to the glorious finished product.

item.title: Turkey Episode with Chef Michael Allemeier
item.media:title: Turkey Episode with Chef Michael Allemeier
item.media:description: Roasting the perfect whole Turkey has long been a challenge. Impress your guests every time with Chef Michael Allemeier’s secrets to the perfect bird.

item.title: Shellfish Episode with Chef Michael Bonacini
item.media:title: Shellfish Episode with Chef Michael Bonacini
item.media:description: Chef Michael Bonacini takes the mystery out of cooking up those tasty creatures from the deep blue sea. Octopus, squid and shrimp are all on the menu as the secrets to cooking these delicious delicacies rise to the surface.

item.title: Rice Episode with Chef Michael Cummings
item.media:title: Rice Episode with Chef Michael Cummings
item.media:description: Chef Michael Cummings gets his hands into the mix cooking up the versatile grain – rice. His masterpiece is risotto and the rice is his canvass. From appetizer to dessert, chef unveils his collection of trade secrets.

item.title: Chocolate Episode with Chef Tim McRoberts
item.media:title: Chocolate Episode with Chef Tim McRoberts
item.media:description: Chocolate is the thing that dreams are made of - rich, sweet, and sexy. Chef Tim McRoberts opens our eyes to the techniques of working with chocolate.

item.title: Beef Episode with Chef Ned Bell
item.media:title: Beef Episode with Chef Ned Bell
item.media:description: The perfect steak is a beautiful thing. Chef Ned Bell works with various cuts of beef and demonstrates the techniques used to create mouth-watering carnivorous dishes.

item.title: Herb & Spice Episode with Chef Elizabeth Manville
item.media:title: Herb & Spice Episode with Chef Elizabeth Manville
item.media:description: Herbs and spice and everything nice, that’s what a great meal is made of. Chef Elizabeth Manville intoxicates us with the fragrance of fresh herbs and spices in a broad range of dishes.

item.title: Fish Episode with Chef Michael Allemeier
item.media:title: Fish Episode with Chef Michael Allemeier
item.media:description: It’s no tale – Fish is an incredibly versatile ingredient to cook with. Chef Michael Allemeier gives us tips on all the fishy business one needs to know.

item.title: The Martini Birthday
item.media:title: The Martini Birthday
item.media:description: It’s Kathy’s 29th birthday (again!) and Rob goes all-martini in his bbq menu. He puts together everything from a martini marinated salmon on cedar plank with a tarragon mayo to a martini marinated leg of lamb. It’s a neat BBQ with a twist!

item.title: Karaoke Slow Ribs
item.media:title: Karaoke Slow Ribs
item.media:description: It’s karaoke night at Robs place. That means lots of bad singing and lots of great food. It’s a ribapolooza! Rob bbqs some smoked spareribs, spicy beef short ribs and fresh grilled veg for his wanna be stars.

item.title: The Engagement
item.media:title: The Engagement
item.media:description: Rob prepares a special romantic dinner for one of his pals who is planning on popping the big marriage question to his date. They wine and dine on a gourmet meal including zucchini crab cakes with smoked salsa, grilled lobster with basil mayonnaise and a chocolate fondue with grilled fruit.

item.title: The BBQ For No Reason
item.media:title: The BBQ For No Reason
item.media:description: You don’t always need a special occasion to have people over for a bbq. Just lots of sun, food and friends! Rob prepares some staples – grilled chicken and ribs with garlic grilled tomatoes on the side.

item.title: Lunar Eclipse
item.media:title: Lunar Eclipse
item.media:description: There’s a total eclipse of the moon out tonight and everyone is coming over to Rob’s for the big show. In the darkness they feast on grilled chicken tikka, pork tenderloin with a banana salsa, and fabulous grilled fennel with anchovy - garlic butter.

item.title: Parents Night Out
item.media:title: Parents Night Out
item.media:description: Rob’s friends haven’t been out since the birth of their first child six weeks ago. In celebration of their first night out, Rob goes all out with a shellfish fiesta. Grilled clams with lemon butter sauce, Caribbean rum shrimp, great scallop brochettes and more are on the menu.

item.title: The Baseball Pulled Pork
item.media:title: The Baseball Pulled Pork
item.media:description: Rob and the boys have a victory dinner of pulled pork, grilled pork tenderloin with great sauces and smokey south western rice as a side after a successful day at the softball tournament.

item.title: Nothing But Chicken
item.media:title: Nothing But Chicken
item.media:description: Rob demonstrates how to do chicken up with style on the grill. He and his friends enjoy a poultry feast with BBQ rotisserie chicken, grilled flattened chicken and delicious smoked sides.

item.title: The Blind Date and Garlic
item.media:title: The Blind Date and Garlic
item.media:description: The girls set Robs lifelong bachelor buddy up on a blind date and Rob decides to bbq mega garlic. Grilled veggies with garlic anchovy dip, grilled trout wrapped in Proscuitto with a roasted garlic mayo and a fresh nicoise salad. Will love blossom in a wake of garlic breath?

item.title: The Mediterranean Feast
item.media:title: The Mediterranean Feast
item.media:description: New neighbors move in across the street all the way from Southern Italy and Rob decides to do an all-Mediterranean bbq dinner in their honour. Hot of the grill are octopus, sardines and Moroccan lamb kabobs along with some mouthwatering sides that will make his guests feel right at home.

item.title: Introducing Natalia
item.media:title: Introducing Natalia
item.media:description: Colourful host Natalia Machado makes mouth-watering dishes from her home country of Argentina like Duck Carpaccio and Churros.

item.title: Thai Fast Food
item.media:title: Thai Fast Food
item.media:description: Charming host Pailin Chongchitnant fills the One World Kitchen cooking studio with fresh Thai aromas.

item.title: Argentinian Comfort Food
item.media:title: Argentinian Comfort Food
item.media:description: Nothing’s more warm and soothing than Argentinian comfort food and host Natalia Machado shows us how to make some!

item.title: Italian Classics with Texture
item.media:title: Italian Classics with Texture
item.media:description: Fun host Vanessa Gianfrancesco prepares an Italian feast with classic flavours and amazing textures.

item.title: Bursts of Japanese Flavours
item.media:title: Bursts of Japanese Flavours
item.media:description: Host Hana Etsuke Dethlefsen makes casual Japanese cuisine like Savoury Japanese Pancakes and Gyoza three-ways.

item.title: DIY your Indian Food
item.media:title: DIY your Indian Food
item.media:description: Cheerful host Vijaya Selvaraju shows us how to DIY some of the important staples of Indian cuisine

item.title: How to Roast a Duck - Thai Style
item.media:title: How to Roast a Duck - Thai Style
item.media:description: Who doesn’t love tender, juicy duck? Host Pailin Chongchitnant shows us how to roast a delicious duck, Thai-style.

item.title: Introducing Vanessa
item.media:title: Introducing Vanessa
item.media:description: Endearing host Vanessa Gianfrancesco whips up a traditional Italian four-course meal.

item.title: Indian Classics
item.media:title: Indian Classics
item.media:description: Ever crave a delicious Indian feast? Host Vijaya Selvaraju cooks up Indian classics for a delightful family meal.

item.title: Teriyaki Two Ways
item.media:title: Teriyaki Two Ways
item.media:description: Host Hana Etsuko Dethlefsen showcases how easy it is to incorporate Japanese flavours into everyday meals.

item.title: Fresh Argentinian Food
item.media:title: Fresh Argentinian Food
item.media:description: Argentinian host, Natalia Machado, exquisitely prepares delicious dishes from Argentina including lamb two different ways.

item.title: Italian Staples
item.media:title: Italian Staples
item.media:description: Gnocchi, polenta, pesto, oh my! Warm host Vanessa Gianfrancesco shares how to make delicious Italian staples.

item.title: Introducing Vijaya
item.media:title: Introducing Vijaya
item.media:description: Cheerful host Vijaya Selvaraju shows us just how easy Indian dishes can be incorporated into everyday meals.

item.title: Introducing Pailin
item.media:title: Introducing Pailin
item.media:description: Host Pailin Chongchitnant introduces us to some of her favourite and simple Thai dishes like Hot and Sour Soup and a decadent Beef Panang Curry.

item.title: No Potato Episode with Chef Michael Cummings
item.media:title: No Potato Episode with Chef Michael Cummings
item.media:description: Tired of potatoes for dinner? Chef Michael Cummings gets back to his roots and cooks with the lesser known tubers and root veggies.

item.title: Egg Episode with Chef Ned Bell
item.media:title: Egg Episode with Chef Ned Bell
item.media:description: Chef Ned Bell takes the egg to new heights by sharing the secrets of creating sauces, custards and of course – the perfect omelette.

item.title: Desserts Episode with Chef Michael Bonacini
item.media:title: Desserts Episode with Chef Michael Bonacini
item.media:description: Chef Michael Bonacini gives his gentle touch to heavenly delights from truffles to candied flowers demonstrating the skilled techniques applied to craft beautiful desserts.

item.title: Pork Episode with Chef Michael Allemeier
item.media:title: Pork Episode with Chef Michael Allemeier
item.media:description: Crackling, loins and legs are three of the pork cuts Chef Michael Allemeier works his magic on as he demonstrates the versatility of this succulent white meat.

item.title: Mise En Place Episode with Chef Elizabeth Manville
item.media:title: Mise En Place Episode with Chef Elizabeth Manville
item.media:description: Great cooking starts with the basics. Chef Elizabeth Manville walks us through various techniques that are used every day in a professional kitchen as the fundamentals to creating phenomenal food.

item.title: Hidden
item.media:title: Hidden
item.media:description: Who doesn’t love a surprise? Seafood loving Chef Spencer Watts makes perch and crab the hidden star in tamales, dumplings, spring rolls and poppers.

item.title: Citrus
item.media:title: Citrus
item.media:description: Chef Spencer Watts shows how the burst of acidity from lemon, lime, orange and grapefruit adds enticing flavor to mild mahi-mahi and sweet scallops.

item.title: Beer and Wine
item.media:title: Beer and Wine
item.media:description: Seafood loving chef Spencer Watts gets casual and formal with monkfish and clam recipes that feature some of his favorite libations – beer and wine.

item.title: Chewy, Chocolately
item.media:title: Chewy, Chocolately
item.media:description: Host Jessica McGovern gives us a sweet taste of chocolate heaven with an overload of chocolatey desserts including a decadent Bombe au Chocolat.

item.title: Eat your Fruits and Veggies
item.media:title: Eat your Fruits and Veggies
item.media:description: Don’t forget to eat your fruits and veggies! Host Jessica McGovern shows us how to include nutritious ingredients into our decadent desserts.

item.title: Tea Party Treats
item.media:title: Tea Party Treats
item.media:description: High tea requires royal desserts! Host Jessica McGovern gives us the lowdown on some sophisticated sweets to pair with a warm cup of tea.

item.title: Nutty
item.media:title: Nutty
item.media:description: Chef Spencer Watts is making a cookbook all about fish. Here he cooks up some swordfish and scallop recipes that feature some of his favorite nuts.

item.title: Spice
item.media:title: Spice
item.media:description: Fish loves spice and Chef Spencer Watts loves fish so he brings the delicious world of spice to halibut and lobster along with some cooling sides.

item.title: Herb
item.media:title: Herb
item.media:description: Chef Spencer Watts shares some of his favorite mackerel and mussel recipes that highlight aromatic, vibrant and fresh herbs.

item.title: Boozy
item.media:title: Boozy
item.media:description: Sturgeon and prawns meet wines and liqueurs in Chef Spencer Watts’ kitchen as he brings seafood and booze together in delicious culinary concoctions.

item.title: Impress Your Kids
item.media:title: Impress Your Kids
item.media:description: Talented host Jessica McGovern shows us how to impress both kids and adults with three over-the-top desserts including a magical Geode Cake.

item.title: Magic in the Middle
item.media:title: Magic in the Middle
item.media:description: Host Jessica McGovern gives us a little surprise on the inside by baking up tasty filled goodies including White Chocolate Lava Cake.

item.title: Stuffed
item.media:title: Stuffed
item.media:description: Chef Spencer Watts dishes on delicious ways to stuff rainbow trout and oysters and how to use them to stuff in a sandwich or even an avocado parcel.

item.title: Pretty Shower Goodies
item.media:title: Pretty Shower Goodies
item.media:description: Make hosting your next shower a cinch with Jessica McGovern’s simple and super cute recipes - like tiny Oatmeal Cookie Cheesecake Cups!

item.title: Flowers!
item.media:title: Flowers!
item.media:description: Flowers aren’t just for smelling – they’re great for baking too! Host Jessica McGovern shows us how to bake some tasty desserts with a floral twist.

item.title: Mixed
item.media:title: Mixed
item.media:description: Chef Spencer Watts show us that seafood may be great on its own, but when you bring different kinds together - it makes for some great eating.

item.title: Italian Sweets
item.media:title: Italian Sweets
item.media:description: Host Jessica McGovern bakes up some delightful Italian classics including a crumbly Cherry-pistachio Biscotti.

item.title: All About Eggs
item.media:title: All About Eggs
item.media:description: Host Jessica McGovern shows us the versatility of eggs by baking up some tasty, egg-centric desserts like Crème Brulee and Lemon Meringue Pie.

item.title: Comfort Food
item.media:title: Comfort Food
item.media:description: Baking host Jessica McGovern warms up the kitchen with some melty, creamy, and chewy treats to comfort you on a rainy day.

item.title: Desserts You Eat with Your Fingers
item.media:title: Desserts You Eat with Your Fingers
item.media:description: Small, fancy, and super scrumptious, host Jessica McGovern shows us how to make glorious desserts that you can eat with your fingers!

item.title: Fancy French Flavours
item.media:title: Fancy French Flavours
item.media:description: Talented baker Jessica McGovern shows us how to get fancy with three stunning French desserts.

item.title: Rich and Delicious
item.media:title: Rich and Delicious
item.media:description: Baking is indulgent – especially when making rich and delicious treats! Host Jessica McGovern shares some foolproof recipes for all things rich.

item.title: Hawaiian Luau
item.media:title: Hawaiian Luau
item.media:description: Looking sexy in his grass skirt, Rob and his fish monger friend Jim Foster hang up their surf boards and throw a great Hawaiian Luau. They prepare a feast including kaluah pork, cowabunga shrimp and some freshly grilled fennel and orange salad. It’s a tropical feast.

item.title: Mardi Gras Party
item.media:title: Mardi Gras Party
item.media:description: Rob throws a hot Mardi Gras party with a Cajun Creole Menu. There’s no parade, but there is great food, fabulous music and beads galore! Skillet Cornbread, Cajun catfish, and creole smoked ribs get this party going an keep it going all night long.

item.title: Bar-Beef-Cue Celebration
item.media:title: Bar-Beef-Cue Celebration
item.media:description: Men love beer. Men love fire. Men love to eat. Put it all together and you get a backyard full of men feasting off of a beer inspired barbecued meal including roasted chicken on a beer can, beer wings, beer burgers and even a beer dressing for potato salad.

item.title: Airband Concert Pre-Party
item.media:title: Airband Concert Pre-Party
item.media:description: Rob and his close friends are singing in an airband contest. To commemorate this occasion Rob prepares a feast of fabulous food including Proscuitto wrapped veal, grilled baby onions, asparagus rafts and parmesan crusted scallops.

item.title: Japanese Farewell Dinner
item.media:title: Japanese Farewell Dinner
item.media:description: Rob’s friend has just accepted a job to teach English in Japan. As a sendoff Rob is preparing an Asian Feast on the grill – juicy slow rotisserie duck, seared fresh tuna and smoked asian veggies. It’s a bon voyage dinner she certainly won’t forget!

item.title: Pajama Party
item.media:title: Pajama Party
item.media:description: Rob reluctantly agrees to throw a Pajama Party BBQ for his friend after they save him some big cash on his taxes. The tea-smoked chicken with an apple-plum chutney, grilled swordfish with a chili coconut crust and roasted veggie stuffed tomatoes send his friends off with sweet dreams of BBQ heaven.

item.title: Fancy Pants Dinner
item.media:title: Fancy Pants Dinner
item.media:description: It’s Rob’s turn to host the annual gourmet dinner. He heats up the grill and pulls together a delicious roasted tomato soup, grilled fillet mignon, sweet blue cheese stuffed pears, and some gourmet salads, and sides.

item.title: Taste of India Celebration
item.media:title: Taste of India Celebration
item.media:description: Tales from Rob’s friend of his adventures in India entice Rob to grill up an Indian flavored feast. He puts together spicy mouth-watering dishes like lobster tails in curry butter, roasted curried potatoes, decadent lamb steaks and a carrot salad to help cool things down.

item.title: Volleyball Tournament BBQ
item.media:title: Volleyball Tournament BBQ
item.media:description: Every year Rob and his friends enter a beach volleyball tournament and Rob is in charge of the pre-game lunch. He goes all light and healthy with an all fish & veggie menu this time including salmon bacon burgers, crab burgers, spicy shark pitas and some delicious tabbouleh.

item.title: Chicken Bake Night
item.media:title: Chicken Bake Night
item.media:description: Spencer Watts cooks up a nutritious meal for four featuring Crispy Lemon Chicken, Sweet Potato Rosti, and Baked Peaches.

item.title: Meatless Monday Night
item.media:title: Meatless Monday Night
item.media:description: Meatless Monday can be done any day of the week. Chef Spencer Watts makes a cheap, filling, family-style vegetarian meal in around 30 minutes

item.title: Spaghetti Night
item.media:title: Spaghetti Night
item.media:description: Host Spencer Watts makes Zucchini Noodles with Jumbo Turkey Meatballs for a healthy take on spaghetti night in around 30 minutes.

item.title: Fried Chicken Night
item.media:title: Fried Chicken Night
item.media:description: Nothing says comfort food better than fried chicken. Chef Spencer Watts shows us all the fixings for a fast, easy, and delicious fried chicken night.

item.title: Fish Night
item.media:title: Fish Night
item.media:description: Kids don’t always love fish – host Spencer Watts shares some simple, inexpensive, and tasty recipes that will change your kids’ opinion of fish night.

item.title: Roast Beef Night
item.media:title: Roast Beef Night
item.media:description: Host Spencer Watts shows how you can make a delicious family-style roast beef dinner in about 30 minutes, for under 30 dollars.

item.title: Lasagna Night
item.media:title: Lasagna Night
item.media:description: Chef Spencer Watts prepares quick, easy, and delicious dishes like Skillet Lasagna, Creamed Spinach, and Banana Ice Cream in under 30 minutes.

item.title: Fish & Chips Night
item.media:title: Fish & Chips Night
item.media:description: 30-minute meals have never tasted this good! Chef Spencer Watts offers up some secrets for the perfect fish and chips dinner.

item.title: Chinese Take-Out Night
item.media:title: Chinese Take-Out Night
item.media:description: Host Spencer Watts shows us some of his favourite budget-friendly Chinese take-out dishes in around 30 minutes.

item.title: Breakfast for Dinner Night
item.media:title: Breakfast for Dinner Night
item.media:description: Breakfast for dinner is quick, easy, and ever-delicious! Host Spencer Watts makes some breakfast classics like a Skillet BLT Frittata.

item.title: Pizza Night
item.media:title: Pizza Night
item.media:description: What’s fun for the whole family? Pizza night! Chef Spencer Watts makes two easy, budget-friendly pizzas for a delicious family-style meal.

item.title: Taco Night
item.media:title: Taco Night
item.media:description: Have a fun, inexpensive, 30-minute fiesta in the kitchen with chef Spencer Watts’ favourite taco night recipes.

item.title: Curry in a Hurry Night
item.media:title: Curry in a Hurry Night
item.media:description: Indian meals are the epitome of a full family dinner. Host Spencer Watts uses bold flavours to make classic Butter Chicken and refreshing Mango Lassi.

item.title: Go Green
item.media:title: Go Green
item.media:description: Desiree Nielsen shows us how to add more plants to your plate with a chocolate avocado smoothie, nori rolls, and sweet potato noodles.

item.title: A Lot on Your Plate
item.media:title: A Lot on Your Plate
item.media:description: Host Desiree Nielsen serves up delicious meals for a busy lifestyle from a mouth-watering breakfast burrito to a no-carb cauliflower pizza.

item.title: Low Carbs, No Problems
item.media:title: Low Carbs, No Problems
item.media:description: Host Desiree Nielsen shows us low-carb options for any meal of the day. Buckwheat pancakes smothered in blueberries? Yes, please!

item.title: Quick Eats
item.media:title: Quick Eats
item.media:description: Host Desiree Nielsen spiralizes zucchini into “zoodles” to create a balanced, veggie-packed pad thai dish.

item.title: Urban Eats
item.media:title: Urban Eats
item.media:description: Fa-what? Fa-waffles! Desiree Nielsen cooks up protein-rich falafel waffles for breakfast.

item.title: Oil
item.media:title: Oil
item.media:description: Chef Spencer Watts makes salmon and prawns pop with flavor as he works with any seafood kitchen’s must-have ingredient: delicious flavored oils.

item.title: Butter
item.media:title: Butter
item.media:description: Butter and fish are best friends. Chef Spencer Watts brings bacon butter, brown butter, maple butter and chimichurri butter to this fishy party.

item.title: Saucy
item.media:title: Saucy
item.media:description: Chef Spencer Watts gets saucy with seafood, making a mascarpone sauce and crab sauce for salmon and orange aioli and clarified butter for crab.

item.title: Salty
item.media:title: Salty
item.media:description: Meaty prawns and melt-in-your-mouth cod are on the menu as trendy chef and seafood expert Spencer Watts gets a little “salty” with seafood.

item.title: Crusted/Coated
item.media:title: Crusted/Coated
item.media:description: High-energy chef and seafood expert Spencer Watts shows how crusts and coatings add tantalizing texture to rich tuna and fresh, tangy oysters.

item.title: Rabbit and Bird Episode with Chef Ned Bell
item.media:title: Rabbit and Bird Episode with Chef Ned Bell
item.media:description: Rabbit and squab are both delicious treats that often get overlooked. Chef demonstrates how you can embrace these new additions to your home menu.

item.title: Fish Episode with Chef Elizabeth Manville
item.media:title: Fish Episode with Chef Elizabeth Manville
item.media:description: Join Chef Elizabeth Manville in exploring the fresh fish you probably know best coming from a can. Sardines, anchovies and tuna have never tasted so good.

item.title: 40th Birthday Bash
item.media:title: 40th Birthday Bash
item.media:description: Rob’s close friend is having a 40th birthday next week. He and some friends are throwing an “over the hill” party in honor of the “old man”. They celebrate the occasion with a port marinated rack of lamb and chicken breasts, herbed barbecued mussels and some great sides.

item.title: Blackout Cookout
item.media:title: Blackout Cookout
item.media:description: A storm has knocked out the power all over the city and there is more rain to come. With no power, some great food from Rob’s fridge will go to waste. He braves the storm and prepares an incredible grilled dinner including a grilled vegetable frittata, bacon wrapped chicken legs and a smoked veal loaf.

item.title: Poker Night With the Boys
item.media:title: Poker Night With the Boys
item.media:description: Rob is having the boys over to play some cards. He’s hoping a great meal of beef fajitas, flattened chili chicken and smoked baked beans will get them to lose their focus and belly up the cash at the table!

item.title: Saturday Afternoon BBQ
item.media:title: Saturday Afternoon BBQ
item.media:description: Rob never really needs an excuse to have a party. It’s Saturday, the sun is shining and that’s a good enough reason to invite some friends over for jerk baby back ribs, honey ginger wings and some spicy shrimp off the grill.

item.title: The Block Party
item.media:title: The Block Party
item.media:description: Every year the neighborhood gets together for a summer afternoon block party. This year it’s at Robs place. He makes a great impression with a menu that dazzles including oyster kabobs, spicy chicken wings, pork skewers, grilled antipasto in endive boats and more.

item.title: Mushrooms and Truffles Episode with Chef Michael Bonacini
item.media:title: Mushrooms and Truffles Episode with Chef Michael Bonacini
item.media:description: Chef Michael Bonacini puts the ‘Fun’ in Fungi – learn the culinary techniques to cooking with mushrooms and the venerable truffle.

item.title: Savoury Pastry Episode with Chef Tim McRoberts
item.media:title: Savoury Pastry Episode with Chef Tim McRoberts
item.media:description: As the Japanese say, we eat with our eyes first. Chef Tim McRoberts demonstrate the techniques of savoury pastries in four eye appealing dishes.

item.title: 80's Night at Rob's
item.media:title: 80's Night at Rob's
item.media:description: Rob parties like its 1988 with a retro 80’s barbeque. With big hair, padded shoulders and bad dancing Rob’s friends are no square pegs. They are “Like Totally” ready to dig into Rob’s feast of herbed veal steaks, rosemary smoked potatoes, lamb & pork souvlaki, and smoked salmon.

item.title: Godfather Italian Feast
item.media:title: Godfather Italian Feast
item.media:description: Rob’s favourite movie of all time is The Godfather. In a tribute to this great film he and his friends gather for an Italian feast off the grill before heading inside to watch the movie. Rob prepares a grilled vegetable pasta sauce, spicy Italian sausage, grilled veal chops and delicious calamari.

item.title: Caribbean Bon Voyage Fiesta
item.media:title: Caribbean Bon Voyage Fiesta
item.media:description: In honour of Rob’s neighbors’ grand prize win of all expenses paid cruise to the Caribbean, Rob prepares a Caribbean Feast. Smoked Pork loin in a passion fruit applesauce, jerk snapper and island salsa are all on his menu as the celebration begins in his backyard.

item.title: Wine & Cheese Party
item.media:title: Wine & Cheese Party
item.media:description: Rob is having a wine & cheese party with a bunch of his closest friends. From the lamb chops to the lobster tails - he combines the wine and cheese into every element of the delicious grilled menu

item.title: Aerobic Marathon BBQ
item.media:title: Aerobic Marathon BBQ
item.media:description: A charity aerobic marathon has everybody desperate for some great food so Rob prepares some delicious healthy dishes including chicken satay, a rotisserie veal roast, polenta kabobs, and ceasar shrimp.

item.title: Successful Jump Celebration
item.media:title: Successful Jump Celebration
item.media:description: Rob survives his first skydiving adventure and throws a celebration of life bbq for his instructor and class. Happy to have two feet on the ground Rob pulls together a feast of the best things in life – lemonade chicken, jumbo grilled shrimp, smoked pork butt roast with crackling and more.

item.title: Volunteer Dinner Party
item.media:title: Volunteer Dinner Party
item.media:description: Rob hosts a bbq party full of incredible food as a sign of gratitude to his community. The brave souls rescued and thus silenced the neighbourhood cat that was stuck in his tree. Rested and full of gratitude Rob whips up a spread that includes pumpkin spiced lamb burgers, mojo pork, veal stuffed onions and delicious coleslaw

item.title: Texas BBQ
item.media:title: Texas BBQ
item.media:description: Rob challenges some rodeo-riding friends from Texas to a race on horseback. He falls a little short leaving him in charge of making and paying for dinner. He ropes together a cowboy feast including stuffed Texmex pork roast, smoked veal shoulder, spicy chicory sausage salad and grits on the grill.

item.title: Non-Engagement Party
item.media:title: Non-Engagement Party
item.media:description: Rob grills up some romance for his commitment-phobic friend and his long waiting girlfriend with a non-engagement party. Watch to see if Rob’s menu of herb rubbed ham, smoked corn chowder, grilled spud skewers and grilled beet kabobs bring his friend to his knees and get him to pop the big question to his Lady.

item.title: Hot Tub Party
item.media:title: Hot Tub Party
item.media:description: It is time for Rob’s annual Hot Tub Extravaganza! His friends sun by the pool and soak in the hot tub while Rob fires up the grill and make some delicious chicken kebabs, pork satay, curried cauliflower on sticks, salmon & fruit salsa and green bean salad.

item.title: Boys Gone Fishing
item.media:title: Boys Gone Fishing
item.media:description: Rob is back from a weekend fishing trip with the boys and it is time for a fish feast. Smoked Trout, whole Trout, grilled smallmouth bass, smoked veggie salsa and saffron rice are on the barbeque as the boys recount tales about “the one that got away.”

item.title: Vegas Night BBQ
item.media:title: Vegas Night BBQ
item.media:description: The cost of having a party every weekend is adding up so Rob decides to throw a Vegas Night BBQ. With a menu of apple stuffed veal roast, rosemary pork, grilled summer beets and a fresh green salad – his guests are sure to bet big and hit the tables with style.

item.title: Treat Yourself
item.media:title: Treat Yourself
item.media:description: Food nerd Desiree Nielsen knows how to add more veggies to our morning and shows us how it’s done with a blueberry, celery, cucumber, and red cabbage juice.

item.title: On Trend
item.media:title: On Trend
item.media:description: Desiree Nielsen adds more plants to her plate with two epic grilled cheese recipes that sneak in veggies.

item.title: Lettuce Eat Lasagna
item.media:title: Lettuce Eat Lasagna
item.media:description: Desiree Nielsen shows how salads can be a tasty main AND served warm with a grilled romaine salad.

item.title: Healthy and Delicious
item.media:title: Healthy and Delicious
item.media:description: Desiree Nielsen ditches regular butter for a fruit butter as she bakes a beautiful apple butter turnover with pecans and gorgonzola.

item.title: Meals on the Go
item.media:title: Meals on the Go
item.media:description: Desiree Nielsen cooks up a green curry vegetable potpie, the perfect flavourful comfort food that’s high in nutrition.

item.title: Easy Comfort Food
item.media:title: Easy Comfort Food
item.media:description: Desiree Nielsen cooks up a filling breakfast with spiralized fried potatoes with eggs and hollandaise.

item.title: Breaded
item.media:title: Breaded
item.media:description: Seafood loving chef Spencer Watts breaks bread and pastry with Canadian cod and squid to make soup, calzones, and two versions of fried calamari.

item.title: Veggies All Day Long
item.media:title: Veggies All Day Long
item.media:description: It’s beets for breakfast with host Desiree Nielsen. This surprising early morning addition gives you a reason to get out of bed!

item.title: Veggies Galore
item.media:title: Veggies Galore
item.media:description: Desiree Nielsen shows how beets can make the icing on a delectable cupcake vibrant and delicious.

item.title: Energy Boost
item.media:title: Energy Boost
item.media:description: Food nerd Desiree Nielsen masters a perfectly cooked eggplant topped with a flavourful charmoula and couscous.

item.title: Fun and Simple
item.media:title: Fun and Simple
item.media:description: Foodie Desiree Nielsen gives life to spotty bananas, transforming it into melt-in-your-mouth bread.
